businessHub: Hato Rey, the financial district of San Juan, hosting banks and corporate offices.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Old San Juan
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A historic district with colorful streets, perfect for a cultural outing with clients.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Condado Beach
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A beach area with restaurants, ideal for a business dinner.

localLifestyle: San Juaneros are vibrant, often enjoying salsa dancing and beach days.
localCulture: A mix of Latin and American influences; expect a warm, bilingual approach in business.
signatureDish: Mofongo - Mashed plantains with garlic and pork rinds, a Puerto Rican classic.

networkingEvents.name: San Juan Business Summit
networkingEvents.description: A summit for professionals in tourism and finance, offering networking with Caribbean firms.

businessTip: Spanish is widely used; knowing basic phrases can be helpful.

name: Guatemala City
timeDifference: 15 hours behind Seoul (UTC+9), 2 hours behind New York (UTC-4), 7 hours behind London (UTC+1)
businessHub: Zona 10, a commercial area with corporate offices and upscale dining.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: National Palace of Culture
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A historic building, great for a cultural outing with clients.

topAttractionsForProfessionals.name: Oakland Mall
topAttractionsForProfessionals.description: A modern shopping complex, ideal for business lunches.

localLifestyle: Guatemalans are family-oriented, often gathering for traditional meals like tamales.
localCulture: Politeness and respect are key; use formal titles in business settings.
signatureDish: Pepián - A spicy stew with chicken, vegetables, and seeds, a Guatemalan favorite.

networkingEvents.name: Guatemala City Business Forum
networkingEvents.description: A forum for professionals in agriculture and trade, offering networking with Central American firms.

businessTip: Traffic can be heavy; schedule meetings with extra travel time.
